questions.question_text:
The Universal Containers Einstein Analytics team built a dashboard with two widgets:
1. List widget associated to the query "Type_2" and grouped by the dimension "Type" (multi-selection)
2. Pie chart widget associated to the query "Step_pie_3" and grouped by the dimension "Type"
Additional notes: * The queries use different datasets.
The team wants any selection in the List widget to filter the Pie chart and vice-versa. Users should be able to choose more than one Type (multi-selection).
What is the recommended way to accomplish the required filtering?

discussion.content: It's B

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct one...

Selected Answer: C
The recommended way to accomplish the required filtering, where any selection in the List widget should filter the Pie chart and vice-versa, is to use a selection-based interaction and apply it to the query of "Step_pie_3." Therefore, option C is the correct answer.

Option A, setting up a result and selection based interaction for each query, would not provide the desired interactivity between the two widgets. It would allow for filtering within each widget, but not between them.

Option B, using "Connect Data Sources" to create a mapping of the two fields from the two datasets, would not provide the desired interactivity either. This feature allows you to blend datasets, but it does not allow for interactivity between widgets.

Option D, using a results-based interaction and applying it to the query of "Step_pie_3," would allow for filtering the pie chart based on the selection in the list widget, but it would not allow for filtering the list widget based on the pie chart selection.

Selected Answer: B
B indeed.

I did some extensive testing in my dev org.
It should be noted that a "selection interaction" would work too, but Connect Data Source should be prefered when possible.
Here the statement specifies that the 2 datasets have the SAME dimension (=Type), so it is possible to use "Connect Data Source".
Multi-selection is compatible with this method. Vice-verso is enabled by "Connect Data Source" in the 2 directions.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer!

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_dashboard_data_source_connections.htm&type=5

choices.A: Set up a result and selection based interaction for each query.
choices.B: Use "Connect Data Sources" to create a mapping of the two fields from the two datasets.
choices.D: Use a results based interaction and apply it to the query of "Step_pie_3".
choices.C: Use a selection based interaction and apply it to the query of "Step_pie_3".

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct answer.

Selected Answer: D
D is the only reasonable asnwer here

questions.question_text:
A client has a dashboard for Sales Managers. They want to have a list filter that shows the name of the month. However, based on the "CloseDate_Month" field, the list filter shows numbers instead of names.
How can a Tableau CRM Consultant use the Dataflow nodes to generate the name of month as a new dimension in the dataset?

The Universal Containers company plans to upload target data from an external tool to Tableau CRM so they can calculate the Sales team target attainments.
The target data changes every month, so the datasets need to be updated on a monthly basis. The target data is a CSV file that contains the Salesforce ID of the sales representative, the target amount, and the month of the target. For each sales representative, the file contains a target for every month of the current year as well as all previous years.
Based on this information, which operation should a consultant use with the Analytics External Data API to upload the file?

discussion.content: I think it is overwrite. Eventhough you have the Sales Rep ID, you do not have the ID to point to the exact sales target attainment record for each month to properly update that record if necessary.

Selected Answer: A
The operation that the consultant should use with the Analytics External Data API to upload the file would be "Append".

The reason for this is that the target data changes every month and needs to be updated on a monthly basis. "Append" operation adds new records to an existing dataset. Therefore, it is the most appropriate option for adding new data to an existing dataset, which is what is required in this case.

Using "Overwrite" would replace the entire dataset with the new target data, which is not desirable as it would delete all the previous data. "Join" is used to combine two datasets based on a common field, but in this case, there is only one dataset being uploaded. "Update" is used to modify existing records in a dataset, but in this case, new records are being added to the dataset, so "Update" is not the correct option.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. The key thing to focus on is that there are existing Sales Rep IDs.

I am wondering : both Overwrite and Update would work, it seems.
However, for new sales rep to be added -> Upsert would be required. Therefore Overwrite might be better ...

Selected Answer: D
--Update-- exists as well
https://blog.bessereau.eu/assets/pdfs/bi_dev_guide_ext_data.pdf

Since the dataset contains a Sales Rep ID, it can be used as key for update.

Selected Answer: C
Based on information in "Tableau CRM External Data API Developer Guide". 
The following operations are available to use when loading data into a dataset:

--Append--
Append all data to the dataset. Creates a dataset if it doesn’t exist.
Note: If the dataset or rows contain a unique identifier, the append operation
is not allowed.

--Delete--
Delete the rows from the dataset. The rows to delete must contain one (and only one)
field with a unique identifier.

--Overwrite--
Create a dataset with the given data, and replace the dataset if it exists.

--Upsert--
Insert or update rows in the dataset. Creates a dataset if it doesn’t exist. The rows to
upsert must contain one (and only one) field with a unique identifier. 

Append cannot contain unique identifiers, and the questions tells us that the csv file contains Salesforce ID's of each Sales representative. Salesforce ID's are unique. 

Based on this information the correct answer should be C, overwrite.
Question was on exam 21 August 2022.

questions.question_text:
A consultant created a Tableau CRM dashboard in a sandbox. Now, the dashboard needs to be migrated into production.
To complete the migration, what are the consultant's three options? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
Indeed

Selected Answer: CDE
Agreed with Snusmumrick

C, D, E is correct!

Change sets

Analytics REST API

Ant Migration Tool

Question was on exam 21 August 2022.

questions.question_text:
Results from an Einstein Discovery story are reviewed with a client. They agree with the findings but noticed that a field used in the story has incomplete data that was not originally noticed. The client is now concerned the model may not be good enough to deploy.
Which two next steps should a consultant consider to improve the outcome? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Reduce the expectations on the model.
choices.C: Review and change the story settings and rerun the story.
choices.A: Identify additional data and include it in the dataset.
choices.D: Rerun the story with the current settings to confirm and solidify the results.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
THis is the correct answer

Selected Answer: AC
"As you investigate insights in your model, you can decide to improve it by revising your settings and creating a newer version. For example, you can include or exclude a column and rerun the analysis"

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_edd_story_modify.htm&type=5

A and C are correct!

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_edd_prep_data_issues.htm&type=5

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.bi_edd_story_modify.htm&type=5
Question was on exam 21 August 2022.

exam.name: Certified Tableau CRM and Einstein Discovery Consultant
